channel.title: Posts on a tech.stuff blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on a tech.stuff blog

item.title: gRPC -- Makes Google remote procedure calls (finally) cool?
item.description: Intro Link to heading Those who thought Remote Procedure Calls (RPC) were an old shoe have been taught better with the offshoot `gRPC developed by Google. I was introduced to RPC on and off with appalling regularity at university. Primarily at that time as CORBA. In some projects of my past working life I also came across old SOAP APIs from time to time. Neither of them made me love RPC very much.

item.title: graphQL
item.description: Intro Link to heading Idea Link to heading Is a language for interaction with graph based data models, tunneled via HTTP-Post. Allows to query and change (mutate) data. Allows an recursive selection of desired nodes and properties. As a client i am able to tell exactly what i expect. There are some standards for navigation through a huge result sets via pagination. It offers a subscription functionality for recognize changes.
